name: AWS EBS volume not encrypted using Customer Managed Key
description: This policy identifies EBS volumes which are encrypted with default KMS keys and not with Keys managed by Customer. It is a best practice to use customer managed KMS Keys to encrypt your EBS volumes. It gives you full control over the encrypted EBS volumes.
searchModel.query: config from cloud.resource where api.name = 'aws-ec2-describe-volumes' as X; config from cloud.resource where api.name = 'aws-kms-get-key-rotation-status' as Y; filter '$.X.encrypted is true and $.X.kmsKeyId equals $.Y.key.keyArn and $.Y.keyMetadata.keyManager contains AWS'; show X;
recommendation:
AWS EBS volumes encryption can be set only at the time of creation of the volumes. So to resolve this alert, create a new EBS Volume with encryption enabled with customer managed key, then migrate all required volume data from the reported volume to this newly created volume and delete reported EBS volume.

To create new EBS volume with encryption enabled with customer managed key, perform the following:
1. Sign into the AWS console
2. In the console, select the specific region from region drop down on the top right corner, for which the alert is generated
3. Navigate to EC2 Dashboard
4. Under 'ELASTIC BLOCK STORE' section, Click on 'Volumes'
5. Click on 'Create Volume' button
6. Select 'Encryption' and Choose customer managed key [i.e. Other than (default)aws/ebs] from 'Master key' dropdown list along with other parameters
7. Click on 'Create Volume' button, Once EBS volume created you can attach that EBS volume to desired Instances.

To delete reported EBS volume which does not has encryption, perform the following:
1. Sign into the AWS console
2. In the console, select the specific region from region drop down on the top right corner, for which the alert is generated
3. Navigate to EC2 Dashboard
4. Under 'ELASTIC BLOCK STORE' section, Click on 'Volumes'
5. Select reported EBS volume
6. If EBS Volume is attached to any instance, Click on 'Actions' dropdown and Click on 'Detach Volume'
7. On 'Detach Volume' pop-up windows, Click on 'Yes, Detach' button
8. Once detached, Now Click on 'Actions' dropdown and Click on 'Delete Volume'
9. On 'Delete Volume' pop-up windows, Click on 'Yes, Delete' button
